author: Saleen Martin
title: 'May this keep you safe from harm': WWII era Bible returned to New York veteran's family
text: Lost Bible returned to slain USAAF airman from World War II [Saleen Martin](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/7245115001/saleen-martin/) During World War II, a woman bought three brothers Bibles to protect their hearts and guide them as they set out for battle. The Bible had a metal cover on the front with the inscription “May this keep you safe from harm." Two of the brothers made it home, while the other, Lt. Edsel J. McKnight of the United States Army Air Forces, was shot down off the coast of France. His Bible was mailed to the family but was lost sometime after. This month, his family finally got it back. Ava Coogan's family is from Albany, New York and they found the Bible in late December while going through their late matriarch’s belongings. On Jan. 11, Coogan met Lt. McKnight’s sister-in-law and returned the Bible to her, allowing her to put it back in its rightful place, next to the ones his brothers brought back home from war. ‘I kept playing with it and flipping through the pages’ Coogan’s uncle and mother found the Bible in a stack of books. Their mother, Rosanne Vartanian, died nearly 20 years ago but was a collector and loved garage sales. “It’s just so random that my grandmother had the urge to pick that up,” she said. “She bought random things. There was no rhyme or reason to it. It was with a stack of other books.” Coogan decided to research the Bible and found out soldiers often took them to war. Some can be found in museums. “The whole premise of it was that the metal cover on the front is like a hard shield,” Coogan told USA TODAY. “They would put it in their coat pockets … like the front breast pocket … that cover would protect their heart from bullets.” Lt. McKnight’s name was also written in the Bible, said Coogan, who was drawn to the Bible for some reason. She couldn’t put it down, she recalled. “I kept playing with it and flipping through the pages,” she said. She noticed that the Bible’s front cover had a slice in it, almost like something was underneath it. She examined it more closely and found a piece of paper folded up inside. She asked her uncle for help, who carefully used a butter knife to get the slip of paper out. Once they retrieved the piece of paper from under the Bible’s cover, they saw that it was a plea for the Bible’s safe return to an address not too far away. Although there was no area code, there was a phone number listed, so the family added their own area code and called. “I was just hoping for the best,” Coogan said. “We found out that number worked.” Lieutenant was shot down off the coast of France When Coogan called the number written in the note, she spoke to a woman named Fay, Lt. McKnight’s sister-in-law. They organized a meetup on Jan. 11 to return the Bible to the family, who is from Porter Corners, part of Saratoga County in eastern New York. Lt. McKnight served in the U.S. Air Force’s 365th Fighter Group and 388th Fighter Squadron. He was flying in a Thunderbolt fighter aircraft in 1944 when he was shot down off the coast of France, [online records](https://rafbeaulieu.co.uk/honouring-the-airmen-of-raf-beaulieu/) show. Fay told Coogan and her family that Lt. McKnight has two brothers. All three of the brothers served in WWII. Fay’s husband, Ray, said his Bible saved his life. “He got shot during the war and it hit where the Bible was, covering his heart, and the bullet went into his arm instead,” Coogan said. Once Lt. McKnight was killed, his belongings were shipped back home to the family. His sister-in-law had all three Bibles on a bookshelf on display. One day, the family was preparing to go to church. Her nephew borrowed the Bible, but knew it was so precious, the family decided to write a note with contact information in case it were ever lost. “He didn't lose it,” Coogan said. “He brought it back after church and I guess what happened is after someone passed in their family, they had an estate sale … and it just accidentally went out with a stack of books.” It ended up in Coogan’s grandmother’s hands, she said. Returning the Bible to the McKnight family was quite the enlightening experience, Coogan said. “That was really cool because that's when we kind of got to hear their story,” she said.

author: Devesh Kumar
title: Love Croissant? Apply for THIS internship with ₹3 lakh a day stipend | Mint
text: Britannia Croissant came up with a creative way to teach its employees, the right pronunciation of French pastry 'Croissant.' The company is offering a one-day internship as a “Croissant pronunciation expert” who will correct people in its offices who pronounce the word incorrectly. The most interesting aspect of the internship is its stipend, which amounts to ₹3 lakh for a day.The company posted a poster of the job advertisement on its Instagram handle and asked the ‘Croissant enthusiast’ to apply. In order to apply, Britannia Croissant asked the candidates to answer some questions and comment on why they should be hired for the \"Croissant pronunciation expert” role.Skills required to become a \"Croissant pronunciation expert”Britannia Croissant shared the following skills required in the suitable candidate for the role.1. Gets excited when people use they're, there, and their correctly2. Gets super angry when people typ lyk dis3. Can comfortably watch English shows without subtitlesHow to apply for the internship?To apply for the \"Croissant pronunciation expert” role, the candidates must click on 'register now' in the Instagram bio of the Britannia Croissant. The link will redirect the users to a WhatsApp bot, who record basic details like name, age, email, etc.The aspiring candidates must comment on the Instagram post of the Britannia Croissant on how they are perfect for the role. Moreover, the company has decided to give bonus points to the candidates who tag Britannia Croissant in their posts and use hashtag #BritanniaCroissantInternship.What is the last date to apply?Although the Instagram post of the company doesn't mention any deadline for the application submission, reports suggest that the last date to apply is 10 March, Sunday. The candidates must apply for the internship as soon as possible to grab the opportunity.

author: Vibha Hegde
title: “Not the zombies I wanted. Big no thanks”: Black Ops 6 Hype Zombies Hype has Died As Players Get Hands-On
text:
People have been looking forward to Black Ops 6 ‘s Zombies mode ever since it was announced. Warzone Zombies didn’t nearly live up to the expectations that people had hoped for, and this was a chance for the franchise to redeem itself.
Unfortunately, judging from the public’s reactions to new gameplay clips, Treyarch may have completely dropped the ball on this one. People are completely writing the mode off, claiming it’s a far cry from what a ‘good’ Zombies mode should look like.
Black Ops 6 Zombies Disappoints in New Clip ⛶ ⛶ ⛶ ⛶ ⛶ × What was previously a lot of hype and excitement for Black Ops 6 ‘s release has been completely replaced by overwhelming amounts of anger and frustration.
In a recent clip shared by @charlieINTEL on X/Twitter, players got a sneak peek at the Liberty Falls map, and the reactions have been less than enthusiastic, to say the least.
This is NOT the zombies I wanted…. Full loadout on start. No Thanks. Still in a Warzone style.. BIG NO THANKS. Wtf is this @Activision https://t.co/ntXQOf7ExV
— Gloveaction (@Gloveaction) August 28, 2024 The clip shows a player loading into Liberty Falls with a full loadout, including an assault rifle.
RELATED COD Next 2024: Here Are All of the Call of Duty Black Ops 6 and Zombies Details Revealed From the Event As soon as the player spawns, they mow down zombies with ease, mixing in some quick melee kills for good measure. It’s very different from the tense, survival-focused experience many fans were hoping for.
This is NOT the zombies I wanted…. Full loadout on start. No Thanks. Still in a Warzone style.. BIG NO THANKS. Wtf is this @Activision https://t.co/ntXQOf7ExV
— Gloveaction (@Gloveaction) August 28, 2024 In the replies, it’s clear that this is not what players wanted. Instead of taking after highly liked iterations, such as from the previous Black Ops titles, it seems to adapt from Warzone .
The reactions aren’t completely surprising—people were skeptical when it was revealed that Zombies would be moving ahead with Operators instead of crews like in previous games, was already Strike One for many.
Fans Feel Frustrated and Unheard After New Clip Emerges Black Ops 6 Zombies fails to keep fans excited even before its release. | Credit: Activision One of the biggest complaints is the ability to spawn in with a full loadout. In previous iterations of Zombies , players typically started with just a pistol and had to gradually work their way up to more powerful weapons as they progressed through the waves.
How hard is it for them to give us a starting pistol and wall buys / mystery box
— Colbey Gross (@ColbeyGross) August 28, 2024 The progression not only made grinding worthwhile but upped the stakes for each match.
RELATED “This gonna get so disrespectful”: COD Black Ops 6 Will Allow You To Take Other Players Hostage As Human Shields and Taunt Them Through Voice Chat Some players argue that you could simply choose to start with a pistol, but others feel that it isn’t the same.
this looks so bad, why are they doing these lay outs. where’s the scary aspects? the horror aspects? wtf is this garbage
— Javier Aliaga (@javieraliaga_) August 28, 2024 The atmosphere hasn’t meshed well with fans either. There aren’t many zombies from what the clips show and the environment and sound design don’t do much to push the ‘horror’ part of Zombies .
The list of complaints stretches long. The COD Next showcase might’ve gotten fans excited for the game, the reality is a far cry from expectations.
Do you think the situation is overblown, or do you agree that Black Ops 6 Zombies looks disappointing? We’d love to hear your thoughts on it in the comments below!

author: Radio Mitre
title: Se viene con todo el tormentón a Buenos Aires con abundante caída de agua y granizo: a qué hora se guarda el auto urgente para no sufrir
text:
[ [Qué es la ciclogénesis, el fenómeno meteorológico que llegará a Argentina en los próximos díasOpens in new window](https://radiomitre.cienradios.com/clima/que-es-la-ciclogenesis-el-fenomeno-meteorologico-que-llegara-a-argentina-en-los-proximos-dias/) ]
Este viernes, el Servicio Meteorológico Nacional (SMN) emitió un alerta nivel amarillo por [tormentas ](https://radiomitre.cienradios.com/clima/se-vienen-con-todo-la-caida-de-granizo-con-tormentas-severas-fuertes-abundantes-y-persistentes-a-que-hora-se-entra-urgente-el-auto/)severas en la provincia de Buenos Aires, por lo que será necesario saber cuándo guardar el auto, dado que también hay probabilidad de caída de granizo.
[Mirá También: Se vienen las tormentas severas junto a granizo en distintas provincias: cuándo se larga y en qué zonas afecta](/clima/se-vienen-las-tormentas-severas-junto-a-granizo-en-distintas-provincias-cuando-se-larga-y-en-que-zonas-afecta/)
Según informó el SMN, las tormentas llegarán durante este viernes. Más precisamente, afectará a las localidades del norte, centro y la costa de la jurisdicción, como Pinamar, Sudeste de General Juan Madariaga y Villa Gesell.
“El área será afectada por tormentas, algunas de las cuales podrían ser localmente fuertes o severas. Estas tormentas estarán acompañadas de ráfagas intensas, ocasional caída de granizo, actividad eléctrica significativa y abundante caída de agua en cortos períodos. Se prevén valores de precipitación acumulada entre 30 y 50 mm, pudiendo ser superados en forma puntual”, detalló el SMN.
Cuáles son las recomendaciones ante una alerta por tormentas severas
- Asegurá los objetos que puedan ser arrojados por el viento.
- Mantenete alejado de los árboles, ya que la fuerza del viento podría quebrar alguna de sus ramas
- Permanecé en construcciones cerradas como casas, escuelas o edificios públicos.
- Mantenete alejado de artefactos eléctricos y evitá el uso de teléfonos con cable.
- Evitá circular por calles inundadas o afectadas.
- Para minimizar el riesgo de ser alcanzado por un rayo, no permanezcas en playas, ríos, lagunas o piletas.
- Si hay riesgo de que el agua ingrese en tu casa, cortá el suministro eléctrico.
- Evitá actividades al aire libre.
[Mirá También: Doble alerta meteorológica por violentas tormentas severas, fuertes, abundantes y con caída de granizo: a qué hora se desata el temporal](/clima/doble-alerta-meteorologica-por-violentas-tormentas-severas-fuertes-abundantes-y-con-caida-de-granizo-a-que-hora-se-desata-el-temporal/)
Cuáles son los tipos de alerta meteorológico según el Servicio Meteorológico Nacional
El SMN advierte a la población a través de sus canales oficiales cuáles son los tipos de alerta meteorológica para conocer las intensidades y la capacidad de daño de cada fenómeno natural.
- Alerta verde: Tranquilidad, no se esperan fenómenos meteorológicos que impliquen riesgos.
- Alerta amarillo: Informate, posibles fenómenos meteorológicos con capacidad de daño y riesgo de interrupción momentánea de actividades cotidianas.
- Alerta naranja: Preparate, se esperan fenómenos meteorológicos peligrosos para la sociedad, la vida, los bienes y el medio ambiente.
- Alerta rojo: Seguí instrucciones oficiales, se esperan fenómenos meteorológicos excepcionales con potencial de provocar emergencias o desastres.

author: Samantha Neely
title: Taylor Swift could have big Florida plans. Fans have theories
text: Taylor Swift fans find clues tied to Florida ahead of ‘The Tortured Poet’s Department’ release [Samantha Neely](https://www.news-press.com/staff/5884663001/samantha-neely/) [Lianna Norman](https://www.palmbeachpost.com/staff/10117762002/lianna-norman/) Taylor Swift is beloved by her devoted clan of fans for many reasons other than just her music. Miss Americana is known and loved by her fans for the [smart clues she leaves in her outfits, music videos](https://www.nbcnews.com/pop-culture/pop-culture-news/live-blog/taylor-swift-album-tortured-poets-live-updates-rcna147489), Instagram posts and even nail polish colors. These clues, or Easter eggs, point to what the pop star might be working on or planning to do next. And with [a new Taylor Swift album](/story/news/2024/04/17/taylor-swift-tortured-poets-department-album-preorder-florida/73352702007/) on the way this weekend, Swift's social media accounts have been active and have her fans hunting for Easter eggs. One recent theory places the spotlight on Florida. Here's a quick guide to how Swift drops Easter eggs for her projects and why Swifties think Florida might be the epicenter of her next big announcement, whatever that may be. First, what are 'Easter eggs' and why is Taylor Swift associated with them? What if we told you she's a Mastermind? But seriously, Swift is known for hiding well-placed clues in her songs, promotional messages and even her outfits and nail polish, for fans to uncover and guess what she could be doing next. Taylor herself told [The Washington Post](https://www.washingtonpost.com/arts-entertainment/2022/10/20/taylor-swift-midnights-easter-eggs/) in 2022, "When I was 15 and putting together my first album, I decided to encode the lyrics with hidden messages using capital letters. That's how it started, and my fans and I have since descended into color coding, numerology, word searches, elaborate hints, and Easter eggs." Here are some examples of her best Easter eggs: - 13 - As her lucky number (born on Dec. 13, 1989), you'll not only spot it in music videos or in her posts but fans have found 13-second intros at the start of her songs or 13 capitalized letters in an Instagram post that lead to a larger clue. - Snakes - Fueled by Kim Kardashian calling her a "snake," Swift has included the imagery for her Reputation album and used the symbol when hinting at her past feuds. - "Nils Sjoberg" - In the "Look What You Made Me Do" music video, she is next a grave of Nils Sjoberg. It's the fake name Taylor used while working on ex Calvin Harris and Rihanna's song, "This Is What You Came For." - "Not a lot going on at the moment" - Her post in April 2020 seemed to poke fun at the pandemic at the time but really, she was working on two of her albums "Folklore" and "Evermore," which released later that year. - The Summer I Turned Pretty - Did you know she actually announced her album "Midnights" way before the MTV Music Awards? In a post about Amazon Prime's The Summer I Turned Pretty using her new song, she specifically says it will come out at "m i d n i g h t." Why do fans think Taylor Swift is leaving hints about Florida before album release? There was a globe set up at a Spotify event for Taylor's new album and this TikTok creator (@swiftiesweetheart) pointed out that there was a pin in the globe, placed on Florida. "I think this globe just revealed everything..." she said in the TikTok video. She pointed out that there is [a song on the track list for Taylor's new album titled "Florida!!!"](/story/news/2024/02/06/taylor-swift-tortured-poets-department-album-songs-florida-florence-machine-post-malone/72487681007/) Taylor is also known for playing around with numbers and fake error codes on her website. On the night that she announced her new album at the Grammys, her website went black and had an error code up that read "Error 321 backend fetch failed." There was also a massive QR code put up in Chicago, as promotion for her album, that led anyone who scanned it to another "Error 321" message in the form of a short video on Taylor's YouTube account. This creator and some other Swifties are theorizing that the "321" sequence could be a nod to a Florida area code, as it's an area code for the Orlando area. Think this is a stretch? It's probably one of the most simple Swiftie theories yet. What is 'The Tortured Poet's Department' song 'Florida!!!' about? While there’s no confirmation on what “Florida!!!” is about, fans have taken to social media with their theories. Fans theorize that "Florida!!!" is about her Eras Tour shows at Raymond James Stadium from April 13 to 15, 2023 — which would have been when details of Swift and Joe Alwyn, her boyfriend of six years, break up were made public, according to [People](https://people.com/music/taylor-swift-joe-alwyn-break-up-after-6-years-together/). Since the track list was revealed, fans looked back at moments from the Tampa shows and noticed the popstar seemed upset when performing songs about her past relationship. Who is 'Florence + the Machine' featuring on 'Florida!!!' track? Florence Welch is the powerhouse lead vocalist for the English indie rock band "Florence + the Machine." Welch is known for several hits over the past decade, such as 2009's "Dog Days are Over," 2011's "Shake it Out" and 2015's "Sweet Nothings" collaboration with Calvin Harris. "Florida!!!" is the first time Swift and Welch have collaborated on a song together. See the entire 'The Tortured Poet's Department' track list - "Fortnight (feat. Post Malone)" - "The Tortured Poets Department" - "My Boy Only Breaks His Favorite Toys" - "Down Bad" - "So Long, London" - "But Daddy I Love Him" - "Fresh Out the Slammer" - "Florida!!!" (feat. Florence + The Machine) - "Guilty as Sin?" - "Who's Afraid of Little Old Me?" - "I Can Fix Him (No Really I Can)" - "loml" - "I Can Do It With a Broken Heart" - "The Smallest Man Who Ever Lived" - "The Alchemy" - "Clara Bow" - Bonus Track: "The Manuscript" There are also three different variants that come with a different album cover and bonus track — The Bolter edition, The Albatross edition and The Black Dog edition. ‘Tortured Poet’s Department’ almost here [Here’s where Florida Swifties can find it](/story/news/2024/04/17/taylor-swift-tortured-poets-department-album-preorder-florida/73352702007/) When does 'The Tortured Poets Department' come out? When can I stream Taylor Swift's new album? After receiving her 13th Grammy, Swift announced her new album [“Tortured Poets Department”](/story/entertainment/music/2024/02/05/taylor-swift-left-fans-easter-eggs-for-tortured-poets-department/72483002007/) would come out Friday, April 19. The album also will be available to stream on most streaming platform, such as [Apple Music and Spotify](https://presave.umusic.com/tsthetorturedpoetsdepartment), on that date.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Don't Miss out on Money: Homeowners urged to check tax bill for lottery credit
text: They are five words that can be worth hundreds of dollars: The lottery and gaming credit. It is applied to a homeowner's annual property taxes, as basically a discount on the total amount due. Catherine Oreto, a Green Bay resident, learned about the credit from a reporter's phone call. "That's kind of exciting, I would be excited to get $275 back on my taxes," Oreto said. The amount of the credit is based on the school district you live in - everyone who lives in a given district gets the same credit. In the Green Bay Area and Howard-Suamico school districts, the credit this year is about $275. The Wisconsin Department of Revenue urged qualifying homeowners to check their property tax bills to make sure the credit was applied. To qualify: -Be a Wisconsin resident -As of 1/1/23, have owned your home and used it as your primary residence. Until January 31, homeowners can apply using this form at the treasurer's office that collects their property taxes. After that, a refund can be requested from the state. The Brown County treasurer's office sent out 8,000 letters this year to homeowners who likely qualified but had not signed up for the credit, said Deputy Brown County Treasurer Chuck Mahlik. About half of the letter recipients signed up for the credit, Mahlik said. Once a homeowner signs up, it is not necessary to sign up again in future years for the same residence.

author: VNExplorer
title: La Finlande émerge en tant que plaque tournante européenne pour les technologies de la défense - VNExplorer
text: La Finlande émerge en tant que plaque tournante européenne pour les technologies de la défensePrincipaux renseignements Les entreprises finlandaises contribuent à l’essor du secteur des technologies de défense du pays grâce à des produits innovants. Les technologies de défense sont devenues une opportunité d’investissement intéressante en Finlande en raison de l’évolution du paysage géopolitique. Un écosystème technologique solide et le soutien du gouvernement ont favorisé la recherche et le développement dans le secteur. Le casque de Varjo, une entreprise finlandaise spécialisée dans les technologies de défense, ressemble à des lunettes de sécurité. Il intègre des caméras, une technologie de suivi oculaire et de l’électronique pour simuler des scénarios militaires à fort enjeu. La précision est primordiale dans son travail, car chaque élément influe sur l’efficacité du produit final. Varjo, comme des centaines d’autres entreprises finlandaises, contribue à l’essor du secteur des technologies de défense du pays. Helsinki est devenu un centre européen de premier plan pour l’investissement dans la défense, la sécurité et la résilience. Demande de technologies de défense Les casques avancés de Varjo offrent 80 programmes de simulation aux forces de l’OTAN, surpassant la réalité virtuelle conventionnelle en intégrant des environnements réels à un contenu synthétique. C’est ce que rapporte la BBC. Cette expérience de « réalité mixte » réduit considérablement le temps et le coût des méthodes de formation traditionnelles. L’entreprise a suscité un intérêt considérable à la suite de l’invasion de l’Ukraine par la Russie et de l’adhésion de la Finlande à l’OTAN qui s’en est suivie. Avant le conflit, les investisseurs hésitaient souvent à soutenir les technologies ayant des applications militaires en raison de préoccupations sociales et environnementales. Toutefois, l’évolution du paysage géopolitique a inversé cette tendance, faisant des technologies de défense un investissement intéressant. Environnement entrepreneurial finlandais D’autres start-ups finlandaises connaissent également une croissance rapide. Iceye fournit des services d’imagerie et de données satellitaires à haute résolution, tandis que Reorbit propose des solutions logicielles pour les satellites. Distance Technologies, soutenue par Google, développe des technologies immersives qui sont testées sur des véhicules blindés par Patria, une ancienne entreprise de défense finlandaise. Le succès des entreprises finlandaises de technologie de défense est renforcé par la prospérité de la scène technologique générale du pays. De nombreux entrepreneurs ont acquis de l’expérience chez Nokia, l’ancien géant de la téléphonie mobile, avant de se lancer dans de nouvelles entreprises. Helsinki a également donné naissance à des licornes comme Oura et Supercell, démontrant ainsi le potentiel entrepreneurial de la ville. Business Finland, une agence gouvernementale, soutient activement le secteur des technologies de la défense par le biais d’un programme de 120 millions d’euros visant à encourager la recherche et le développement. Cette collaboration public-privé souligne l’urgence de faire progresser la position de la Finlande dans ce domaine qui évolue rapidement. Si vous souhaitez accéder à tous les articles, abonnez-vous ici!

author: Palmer Haasch
title: Joan Baez Actor Monica Barbaro First Met Chalamet at Music Rehearsal - Business Insider
text:
Entertainment 'A Complete Unknown' star Monica Barbaro met Timothée Chalamet in a very 'Bob and Joan' way — duetting at a music rehearsal Palmer Haasch 2024-12-26T22:39:40Z Share icon An curved arrow pointing right. Share Facebook Email X LinkedIn Copy Link lighning bolt icon An icon in the shape of a lightning bolt. Impact Link Save Article Icon A bookmark Save Read in app Angle down icon An icon in the shape of an angle pointing down. Monica Barbaro and Timothée Chalamet as Joan Baez and Bob Dylan in "A Complete Unknown." Searchlight Pictures This story is available exclusively to Business Insider subscribers. Become an Insider and start reading now. Have an account? Log in . Monica Barbaro plays Joan Baez in "A Complete Unknown," which follows Bob Dylan's early career. Barbaro told BI that she and Timothée Chalamet, who plays Dylan, first met at a music rehearsal. Barbaro did vocal training to sing like Baez and duet with Chalamet's Dylan.
In "A Complete Unknown," Timothée Chalamet and Monica Barbaro inhabit two musical legends: Bob Dylan and Joan Baez . True to form, the actors first met on set at a music rehearsal.
Advertisement The film, directed by James Mangold, stars Chalamet as a young Dylan during the early years of his career, from his 1962 debut self-titled album through his controversial pivot to electric instrumentation . It features many of Dylan's contemporaries from the era, including Baez (Barbaro), Pete Seeger (Edward Norton), and Johnny Cash (Boyd Holbrook) .
Timothée Chalamet playing Bob Dylan in "A Complete Unknown." Macall Polay The film's greatest strength is its music, much of which was recorded live on set. Not only does Chalamet perform live as Dylan, but he duets in-character with his collaborators. That led to the perfect meeting for the actors.
Advertisement "We heard each other's voices in recording studio sessions, because I would sing duets to his voice," Barbaro told Business Insider. "The first time we met was a music rehearsal, and it was just the most beautiful experience to me."
Like Chalamet, Barbaro also did vocal training to play Baez in the film, working to emulate the singer's trilling vibrato while also researching Baez's life and career. The actor told BI that she knew the music was going to be "the biggest hill to climb," and she knew that Chalamet — who spent five years preparing to play Dylan — had been practicing. By the time they first met, she felt ready to hold her ground not only as an actor, but as a musician.
"Getting to play next to him and hear the harmonies of our voices and the accompaniment, so complementary of each other — that was a career highlight," Barbaro said.
Advertisement "I'm so glad we waited until that point to meet each other and to work with each other," she continued. "It was more true to a Bob and Joan version of the meeting that we'd have these musical proficiencies, that we could collaborate and play together."
Read next Movies Advertisement Close icon Two crossed lines that form an 'X'. It indicates a way to close an interaction, or dismiss a notification.
